sentence.Network_en: She has journeyed through purgation watching crimson turn to black.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French purgacion, from Latin purgatio(n-), from purgare 'purify' (see purge)

means.word_mean: 1. purging the body by the use of a cathartic to stimulate evacuation of the bowels
2. a ceremonial cleansing from defilement or uncleanness by the performance of appropriate rites
3. the act of clearing yourself (or another) from some stigma or charge
